eventbus

Class EventBusManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • eventbus.EventBusManager

  • public class EventBusManager
extends java.lang.Object
    EventBusManager.java eventbus Created by Sophie ZECRI on 03/05/2018 Copyright (c) 2016 myBrain Technologies. All rights reserved. EventBusManager is responsible for managing communication between the different packages by using a publisher/subscriber system

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static org.greenrobot.eventbus.EventBus BUS
      Creates a new EventBus instance that will manage the events Each instance is a separate scope in which events are delivered.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EventBusManager()
      EventBusManager contains all the methods for posting events, registering and unregistering subscribers It helps communication between the different packages Once an instance of EventBusManager is created, the publishers can post event to the Event Bus
      EventBusManager(java.lang.Object subscriber)
      EventBusManager contains all the methods for posting events, registering and unregistering subscribers.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void postEvent(java.lang.Object event)
      Publishs the given event to the Event Bus.
      void registerOrUnregister(boolean isRegistration, java.lang.Object subscriber)
      Registers or unregisters the given subscriber class to receive events from the Events Bus.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • BUS

        public static final org.greenrobot.eventbus.EventBus BUS
        Creates a new EventBus instance that will manage the events Each instance is a separate scope in which events are delivered.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventBusManager

        public EventBusManager()
        EventBusManager contains all the methods for posting events, registering and unregistering subscribers It helps communication between the different packages Once an instance of EventBusManager is created, the publishers can post event to the Event Bus

      • EventBusManager

        public EventBusManager(java.lang.Object subscriber)
        EventBusManager contains all the methods for posting events, registering and unregistering subscribers. It helps communication between the different packages. Once an instance of EventBusManager is created, the subscribers can receive event from the Event Bus Warning : subscribers can't receive any event if they are not registered.
        Parameters:
        subscriber - is the subscriber class to register for receiving events from the Event Bus

    • Method Detail

      • registerOrUnregister

        public void registerOrUnregister(boolean isRegistration,
                                 java.lang.Object subscriber)
        Registers or unregisters the given subscriber class to receive events from the Events Bus. Subscribers must unregister once they are no longer interested in receiving events. Subscribers can't receive any event if they are not registered.
        Parameters:
        isRegistration - is true to register the subscriber class and false to unregister the subscriber class.
        subscriber - is the subscriber class to register for receiving events from the Event Bus.

      • postEvent

        public void postEvent(java.lang.Object event)
        Publishs the given event to the Event Bus. The Event Bus will deliver it to registered subscribers.
        Parameters:
        event - contains data to transmit to the subscriber class.
